fields.description:
Vmware VMs are reporting incorrect state, orphaned VMs, and Node in 'not-ready' as a result of an instance churn test against vmware (0-8 VMs being ran 2 per reservation over 0-4 concurrent tests/jobs using an HVM instance store image and m1.small).

comments.body:
Matt,
I've done some changed to the broker code and run non-stop 70 instances with direct ESXi connection and 120 with connection via vCenter. I have not see the same issue so far.

git 8b2dc16a14a93d464e7c7f06b4a62c4754bd7f0e
Marking this as a DUP of euca-9446
Not sure if this is the same issue as euca-9446 (and related/linked issues), reopening per euca-9446.
I think the EUCA-9496 better describes underling issue.
We suspect this problem may go away after the tickets linked as dupes (EUCA-9498 and EUCA-9496) are resolved.
Please, retry this churn test now that the fix for EUCA-9496 is in.
I've run churn tests against a vmware cluster all weekend, using both  Windows BFEBS, and linux instance store HVM images. I have not been able to reproduce the original issue. Closing.
Woot! Thanks, [~mclark]! (Maybe we finally nailed this one.)
